column4: is there a command i can run to get the name of and model of my graphics card in linux terminal?
can you run dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg and when it asks you which driver say sis ?
can you run sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg and when it asks you which driver say sis ?
have you restarted you desktop since the change?
it will write sis as the driver in that /etc/X11/xorg.conf file
when you configure it with sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg and tell it to use sis
what does this tell you ?   grep sis /etc/X11/xorg.conf
either it returns Driver "sis"  or it doesn't
you must have fat fingered the command.. Ctl-c
what does this tell you ?   grep -i sis /etc/X11/xorg.conf
good.. that means you have told xorg to use sis.. now if you can't tell it to with dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg then you might have to edit the file by hand to show Driver "sis" and restart X
- yes ok but i did already have that entry in my file earlier
open it with an editor.. grep can't find it because it's not there.. that maybe what it back up tho
